abstract: Stories of torture, rape and killings come to light during witness testimony in trial of Hissene Habre, former president of Chad, who is accused of crimes against humanity, war crimes, and torture from 1982 to 1990; trial is being held in Senegal by special court, known as Extraordinary African Chambers, that was created specifically for Habre.

headline.print_headline: Trial of Chad’s Ex-Leader Brings Harrowing Tales of Abuse
headline.main: Trial of Chad’s Ex-President Brings Harrowing Accounts of Abuse

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject

snippet: Men and women from Chad testified about their ordeals in a Senegal court, where Hissène Habré is being tried for atrocities during his rule between 1982 and 1990.
